instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
PPBUS
Pp3v42 
SMC Reset 
PM SLP S4 L

all ok

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> Voltages are erratic. I get them but it dies down randomly. Fan Spin also random

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: Cleaned and re installed <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> . Getting all voltages when there is fan spin. Voltages drop to zero when fan stops. (<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>)

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: It goes upto 200 mAh then goes down to zero once when the fan stops and then i get max fan spin and Amp Draw is stuck at 240 mAh

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
Any history available?
Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> goes high?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
No History.
Yes Pin 3 goes high when fan is spinning

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: What about <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> IS 0V

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>?
If good, then heat PCH with quality flux.

First be sure, all voltages from page 11 are there.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
<CHIP>U1930</CHIP> / <CAPACITOR>C1930</CAPACITOR> / <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR> missing on the board. 

Repairs have been done previously. Should we install them first ?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: Of course; PCH requires <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
Reconstructed all the Missing Points around <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>.
 Now i get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  at 3.3V.
Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> stable at 3.4V

<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> IS 1V
<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> IS 0V. The fan stops spinning as soon my probe touches <RESISTOR>R1955</RESISTOR> Pin 2.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> is a very sensitive test point.

Do you get USB activity now?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: My usb tester just went bad a couple of days ago. A new one will come in a week. I dont have a usb with led to test. But i get a constant fan spin.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: You can use a bootable pendrive with LED link.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: I have light on the ssd when connecting a external ssd.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: Just steady power LED, or flashing Link LED too?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: Flashing too.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
Try PRAM reset, should bring chime on.
Internal Caps Lock LED should also react.
Check external video too.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: PRAM reset did nothing .

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message: Is it repairable?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
If the Link LED of USB HDD flashes, there should be USB activity.
I hope you check that correctly.

You may have accumulated crap underneath PCH.
Heat to burn it...

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
Further inspection revealed that <RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR>/8 were missing on the board. Reconstructed that area.

Did a PRAM reset - but nothing.
 PRAM Reset makes the fan stop. 
On/OFF key toggle makes the Fan on/off.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins
threads.message:
Do you still get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high?
Tried to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath PCH?
